S.FORM: meredek ku i takesiyan a pituwa tuki harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: kemiyarakaz lra temakesi, musavak na sinsi kana talrevaw, kema na pancang, “katikezir! sungal!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: kema'izang mi marengay, “'inavayan sinsi.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: a temakesi mi mu, tu panadamaw mi kana sinsi za aiyupan. kananta piningaiyan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

S.FORM: iturus mi kana sinsi miyup, zi semenay mi kana senay na aiyupan.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: sazu ku nilrazalrazam nanta piningaiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

S.FORM: kana wariwari mukuwa ku i takesiyan, kana wariwari menadanadam ku kanata piningaiyan, rarengay ku pakinger kani inani.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: i Inor nanku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Inor。
My name is Inor.

S.FORM: i Asing tu ngadan ni amalri
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad’s name is Asing.

S.FORM: i Sunay tu ngadan ni inani.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是 Sunay。
My mother’s name is Sunay.

S.FORM: muketrep ku 'ami harem kana 'ami.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: ulra i ivalri, i Singkay nantu ngadan, muketrep misama' za saya nantu 'ami harem.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Singkay，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Singkay, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: mukasa mi temakesi kana maresan na takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: sahar mi semenay iniyam i ivalri na ma'inayan.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: sahar ku melrangulranguya nu katalaulepan, marelrang mi saruma'enan mukuwa melrangulranguya.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: sahar ku malrazam za vekal za 'ali'an, karuwa mi mukasa semenasenay zi melrangulranguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: a alrak ku za Pinuyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 我是卑南族的小孩。
I am an Pinuyumayan child.

S.FORM: ulra naniyam ruma' i Mulivelivek.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在初鹿部落。
Our family lives in Mulivelivek.

S.FORM: lralruwatr mi saruma'enan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatelu mi maruwadiyadi.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: i inku, i amalri, i inani, i ivalri na ma'inayan zi i ivalri na vavayan mukasa mi kazu.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: tihasar i amalri, a kinsas i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: varivariw i inani, a ising i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: nu kazu i ruma' i amalri, temarapinuyumayan kimazayar kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Pinuyumayan language with us at home.

S.FORM: kana katalaulepan nu derun murumaruma' mi i zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: mukasa mi mukuwa kikakiyasa iniyam na ivalri.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: sahar ku kananku niruma'enan.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: marelrang mi iniyam i inani mukuwa muzangiya harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: tremangiyangiya na lingatr a 'uninan, 'azi vi'as zi 'azi lritek na wari, say na vali mu, valiyan.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: kemayan mi kana tralutralun mekan za pang, tu 'uninay mi kana 'unin, salaw sadeku.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: a piya kare'alri, demuni' na lingatr.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kani inani, kemuda zi demuni' na lingatr?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: kema i inani, kamawan za zazuwa a variw.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: uniyan za kutrekutrem na lingatr, mupatraran lra na vitu'en.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: muwaruma' mi lra.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: kiyami ku kana vitu'en i dalan a muwaruma' mi.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: kiyalrimayan za 'azi zuwa na variw, maranger ku ziya mukuwa muzangiya.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: ulra nanku takesiyan i ngidiran i kaniyam, kana wariwari ziya kemakawang ku mukuwa i takesiyan, zi kemakawang muruma'.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: 'azi ma'izang naniyam takesiyan, kaitayan na temakakesi, marekalrazam mi mapiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: na temakakesi ziya, mareparazuk i renarenazan, mukasa malimali, mazayazayar.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: na sinsiyan mu, mukasa kaniniyam muwazangi kamawan za ma'izang za ruma' na takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: maidap mi kana wariwari ziya, niyam idapay temulre'ay na talrevaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: ulra na trau mukuwa mitrula za lataw, ulra na maidap za dare'.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: niyam idapay ziya i puyupuyung kana takesiyan, marepuwalraalrang mi mapiya, mukirungetr na takesiyan kana wariwari.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: muruma' ku i zekalr mukuwa muzangiya kani imu na ma'inayan a daman.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: sawariyan mi lra 'azi marepana'u, salaw ku sare'er kanintaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: mena'u i imu kaninku, tu payasaw ku paekan za taramunah, zi tu pa'auway za kurisepa.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: salaw tavu' tu sinalem na taramunah ni imu, imaran.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: sahar ku 'emau tu kurisepa ni imu, 'inava nu 'emau ta.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: kare'alriyan lra, mukasa mi iniyam i imu na vavayan demeru za kare'a'alriyan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: demeru za sazu za kare'a'alriyan i imu ulra a vulraw, a terukuk, a siyak zi a semuli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: piya kare'alri, mukuwa mi i sayheng kikulanga.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: melak za sazu za vurasi, za vu'ir zi za rogiyo, urungu muruma' kema veray kaninku.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: kay ku lra kema ku zi zuwa lra muzangiya nu masalr lra ku kuwayaw na imulri.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: tu pilralrangaw mi kana sinsi mukuwa i tungwuyuan harem, muturik mi i sulray tremima' za kippu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: musavak mi i tungwuyuan mu, merengay na sinsi: “i ngawayan mu a 'aya'ayam, i likuzan mu, a unaunan. uwa na'u inmu mapiya.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: makaud ku za unan, semeneng 'azi ku nana'u za unaunan.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: mena'u ku za sazu za 'ayam, kazu valriiviiyan kana kawi, mena'u ku ziya za 'alretru kazu kana kawi tu vuwang alrupe'.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ulra a zo, a eva zi a likulraw, 'azi ku ziya mena'u kanani na haramhaman, salaw ku semangal harem.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: sazu ku sinasing harem, pana'u kani ama zi kani ina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: nu masalr kuwarelrang ku kani ama zi kani ina mukasa zuwa.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: kanini na kasede'an, marelrang mi iniyam i ivalri mukuwa muzangiya kani amalri na maralrak.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: kemay mi i Tayhok muitras za kisiya mukuwa i Valangaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: meredek lra i Valangaw, i amalri na maralrak na mipalizing zuwa kitrevunga kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: 'azi adawilr i siyataw tu ruma' ni amalri na maralrak nu mipalizing ta dika mu, meredek ta lra.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: adalrep kantu ruma' ni amalri na maralrak mu, ulra a ma'izang a puwarikanan, marelrang mi mukuwa kana puwarikanan mizidēnsiya.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: kazu mi kana puwarikanan, tu pilralrangaw mi ni amalri na maralrak temavur za takulris zi muitras za eva.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: a karauv, marelrang mi mukuwa i tokay keraviya.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: sazu a palizing i tokay, semeneng miotobay mi mukuwa i kazu.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: a muwaruma' mi, tu trakawaw naniyam otobay zi muitras mi za bas muveruk.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: harem, muruma' mi lra i Tayhok, 'azi mi malrazam za tu atrevungay lra nantu otobay?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: a lralrak mi ziya kaazu mi i Mulivelivek, a temakesi mi lra muasalr mi mukuwa kazuwa i Tawyuan, kazu mi i tokay muvaaw.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在初鹿，上學以後，就搬到了桃園，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Mulivelivek. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: temakesi ku lra kana daygak, mukuwa ku menadanadama za mikireeman kana kakuwayanan kana Yuancumin, malrazam ku lra kana Yuancumin i Taiwan ulra tu kakuwayanan a marekamelrimelri.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: semeneng, mukasa ku kani ivalri na ma'inayan mukuwa kiyumalra kana dawdawan i zekalr. maranger mi malrazam za naniyam kukuwayanan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: walu pulu' lra tu 'ami na dawdawan, mawmu, maresan maralralrak ziya nu mena'u ta.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: kiyumalr ku kanintaw za sayhu u za emaeman ngai. dalus nu temarapinuyumayan i intaw. sayhu temarabunun, temarapayrang, zi temaradipung.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的卑南語說得很流利，也會說布農語、閩南話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in pinuyumayan, as well as Bunun, Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: ku kiyumalray i intaw mu, malrazam ku lra za a lralrak ziya i intaw mu menanadam za ngai za Dipung. a Bunun tu 'azin, malrazam i intaw za sazu a Payrang i kiyakarunan zi sayhu merengay za kemani sazu za ngai.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: mazayazayar mi mu, merengay na dawdawan za sazu a kinadaman za vulrtrengan za pa'alrupan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ara 'azi patulru'ay mi malrazam naniyam kiningeran zi, ulra naniyam soci na semasing. maruwa mi ziya kingkinger.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: 'azi ku kamalrazam zanta kakuwayanan a lralrak ku ziya. maira ku saema kaninta Yuēncumin.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: nu kamalrazaman ku sazu lra mu, marakatatena' a pinuyumayan ku, a kinipilimi'an ku, zi a trau za mamatras.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為卑南族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a pinuyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: kanini na kararauvan, waruma' lra i wadilri na ma'inayan.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: mukasa ku kani imulri na vavayan mukuwa i iciba tremima'a za terukuk. paadang mi demuru za imaran za kararaviyan veray kani wadilri na ma'inayan.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: melavat mi kana menaniwan kana kulang mu, sazu na kulakulang na vukalan ziya.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: tremima' mi za takungkung, za tanuvan, zi za ninzing.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: kema izu na tawki i ngidiran kana menaniwan kana inaekan na vuwa' “tavu' nanku re'a zi na lupas. trima' za saema mu.”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: tremima' mi za re'a zi za lupas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: melavat mi kana menaniwan kana 'alum mu, merengay na tawki, “tratrima' u za eman? semver zi ma'izang na terukuk harem. saya mu, teluwa leman.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: kapazangalan kema i imulri na vavayan. tu kiyumalray na tawki, “karuwa madulu saema?”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: mawmu kema na tawki madulu lra. 'azi ta marakadulu lra.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kema na tawki na 'udar, alamu trima'i ninku vulraw. ma'izang zi semver ninku vulraw.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又肥。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: talalikuzan lra mu, tremima' mi lra za terukuk zi za vulraw. muruma' mi demeru lra za saetu za irupan.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: mengangara mi sawariyan zi 'aremeng lra.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: padingwa muruma' i wadilri na ma'inayan zi merengay maherareher 'azi maruwa semede' na hitay. palru masalr kana sasede'an mu. karuwa ku lra muruma'.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: sazu ku dineruwan lra kema i imulri na vavayan, vinayu mapiya mukasaya ta mekan.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: demaulr mi za wadadiyanan, mukasa ta mekana za karaviyan za merevawan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: ulra ku sanadaman a sasa, mingadan kani Kulas kema. marayas malaalalup murung za emaeman.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kulas，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kulas, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: nu temakesi ta mu, kivulas i initaw za impis, za aitrul, za vavalrayan kana sanadaman.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: nu parasan, nu parepuwan, nu paretelun mu, taw pavulasay za emaeman na nintaw.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: mawmu, ulra tu kakuwayanan na kuwatreng, marayas 'azi pavavuliyas tu kinavulasan.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: talikuzakuzan lra mu, 'azi lra muwai pavulas a trau za emaeman kanintaw.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: kana saya wari mu, mukasakasa ta mapiya mukuwa muzangiya.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: maranger mukuwa mutraluna i Kulas kana kalidalanan, mawmu malalup murung za aitrulan.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kulas想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kulas wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: kivulas i intaw za aitrulan kana sanadaman, mawmu tremuvang a trau kanintaw za 'azi ku murung i inku.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: mahelr zi matrangis i Kulas. 'ilremes zi merengay, “kemuda zi 'azi muwai a trau pavulas za aitrulan kaninku.”
S.TRANSL: Kulas急的哭了出來。他生氣的說:「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!」
Kulas burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: merengay na sanadaman kanintaw, halrana 'azi muwai u murung ziyanay, zi 'azi u pavaveliyas na emaeman na pavulas kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: a dadaman, meredek i Kulas i takesiyan semavalr, tu paveliyasanay lra ni Kulas za emaeman kana kinivulasan na sanadaman.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kulas很早就到學校了，Kulas把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kulas arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: irayan kema i Kulas kanantaw sanadaman, zi nu kaidaidan mu, 'azika'a'azi ku murung za emaeman lra. lrayuwan kema ku kanimu za muwai pavulas za emaeman kaninku.
S.TRANSL: Kulas向同學們道歉，並說:「我以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借我東西。」
Kulas apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: a ma'alrup i amalri i zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: a lralrak ku ziya mu, mitazaw zi mikuwang muwapatraran nu 'aremeng i amalri zi i amalri na maralralrak.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: nu 'uninan lra, mirawa muruma' nazu.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: nu eman mu a vavuy, nu eman mu a nawan, nu eman mu a 'anavang.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: tu sasepadanay zi pa'a'atraranay na rawa kana zinekalranan i uwasavakan kana zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: marayas ku sasakiyaw i amalri, maranger ku kurelrang kani amalri mukuwa 'emalrupa.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: nu ma'izang ku lra mu, tu pilralrangaw ku lra kema ni amalri.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: sayhu mipetrir penetrir za rawa na ma'inayan i zekalr. sayhu demaway za sawail zi za tutak nazu.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: sayhu demaway za sawail i amalri. merengay i amalri, “papapetrir za 'anavang i ini. taran'ui tu dinapalran na rawa. papuwa ta za petrir kanantu wakalr.”
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說:「這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。」

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: muramawan karuwa dika mukasa kana ma'izangan mukuwa 'emalrupa, menadanadam ku demaway za petrir kana wawariwari. kadika tatena' mirawa ku petrir kema ku.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: mena'u i amalri mu, zi merengay kaninku, nu kaidaidan mu, 'azika'a'azi u a mutuma'alrup za kerevatan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: ma'izang ku lra harem, ku parekaw ku kadalis zi valru', zi kurelrang ku kani amalri mukuwa penetrira.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: niyam pa'a'atraranay naniyam rawa kana zinekalrnan nu muruma' mi i zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: merengay i amalri, sasungal ta kana temuwamuwan zatu ipulu'em, tu parevawaw ta za rawa za sasazu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: puwari ku mukuwa i takesiyan a 'emanamanan.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: a mukuwa i takesiyan mu, malalup ku murung za lravatr.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: 'azi ku murung za emaeman.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: a temakesi mi mu, kipukasa ku za ku lralrang mena'u za valray.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: a kipatalram mi mu, taku pavulasay za impis zi aitrul za ku lralrang.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: marengay i sinsi kaninku nu masalr mu dikadika marahan
S.TRANSL: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
amanan na puwari lra!""

S.FORM: nanku 'ali'an i sinkay tu ngadan. alrak za pinuyumayan i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫sinkay，他也是卑南族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is sinkay, and he is also an pinuyumayan child.

S.FORM: mukasa mi temakesi i Likavung.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在利嘉村讀書。
We study together in the Likavung tribe.

S.FORM: marayas mi mukasa kingkinger tu vinavatiyan na dawdawan na vativatiyan, sayhu mi temarapinuyumayan mapiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說卑南語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the pinuyumayan proficiently.

S.FORM: tihasar zi semever ku, alusu zi varivariw i singkay.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，singkay很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while singkay is short and thin.

S.FORM: salaw mivaawan i singkay, zi sahar mi mapiya kantaw.
S.TRANSL: singkay很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
singkay is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: 'a'ari'ariyan i takesiyan harem kana wari, maanay za sazu na marepakuwakuwa i takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: ulra a makakezeng za tali, tremapi'i / 'eresur za mali, pavekas, muwarak zi papana 'an.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: mare'ari'ari ku za pavekas.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: a pavekas ku mu, kuretapelra' ku, ku tuzu mudara' / mudamuk za sazu.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: mawmu marahan ku, zi patrutru mungawayan pavekas.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: meredek ku kana raredekan mu semangal na trau mapiya.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ara 'azi ku muelak za sanga, mawmu salaw ku semangal, 'alra na piya ku lra kana mare'ari'ari.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: marelrang mi iniyam i amalri mukuwa muzangiya kani ama na maralrak a daman.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: mavuli' tu kuwi ni ama na maralrak.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: marengay kaniyam i intaw, mutravelrang tu sa'uv na ruma'.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: a temulre'ay kana sa'uv i intaw mu, mutani kemay kana sa'uv.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: miinurung za 'alum na hung zi za puran i amalri veray kani ama na maralrak.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: i inku zi i ama na maralrak mazayazayar mi i kiya'ezengan, marengay za sazu za vativatiyan i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: a uwaveruk ku mu, tihasar u lra, zi marekavangsar u lra kema kaninku i ama na maralrak.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: marengay ku, “nu 'inava lra tu kuwi ni ama na maralrak mu, alamu ziya i kaniyam muzangiya.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: kazu kana 2022 'ami, pakaygi na séhu kana karuwa pusavak za tu ngadan na 'atayan i mibunsiyo na Yécumin.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kiumaumalr ku lra kani Avarang mawna vangesaran i zekalr na sawariyan kiyami pakirev kana séhu za “pusavakaw za tu ngadan na 'atayan.” i mibunsiyo.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Avarang。
I interviewed Avarang, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: kanini na kasede'an i inku zi i intaw makakuret mi kana auwa kanantu ruma' kiumaumalr kantaw.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: kazu kana kiumaumalran mu, pakalrazam kaninku zatu pinarevuwa' tu ngadan, zi kirekalrazam ku tu niruma'enan, zi nantu zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kiumalr ku kantaw kemuda zi marukerang patrutru kana puwavalis za ngadan, a awatr ziya na ipuvalray 'azi 'inava ziya maw?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: marengay kaninku i intaw, 'alrana pimanayaw za valray na minkuk 'azi karuwa patulre'ay paredek za tu ngadan, nu venavina a trau kantaw mu “izu i... eman” kema, zi mawna kemazu mupana lra a kalikeliked na sime'an na ngai.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \izu i... eman

S.FORM: marengay i Avarang, “na vinavalray kanantu valray na Yéncumin na ngadan mu maw tatena' nanta ngadan. nanku ngadan paruveli kananta 'inalrayan, nanta niruma'enan, nanta kinayanan, kiyalriman kana kazuwan ta mawan atrevung tu ngadan i intaw.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Avarang said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: a daman marelrang mi iniyam i mulri na vavayan mukuwa kana kazuwan na trau puwayar meniwana, i mulri na vavayan mu miinurung za sazu za tu sinalem na kulang, zi demaway ziya kana imaran na akanan na Yéncumin veray kana mapiyapiya.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: sahar mapiya tu puwaayaran meniwan ni i mulri na vavayan, kazuwan na trau na tremima' tu kamangulr zi la'ula'usan, zi kazuwan na trau na temalram tu inevel na irupan.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: salaw imaran tu dineru na pa'at zi tinaveras, ulra ziya na 'alum za vavuy tu pukasayaw za tana' demeru, kazuwan na lavang na mukezeng kanantu ngulringulran, zuwa muturika mapiya kana puwaayaran meniwan i kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: nu demeru za eman i mulri na vavayan mu, kazu ku i saninin demadaulr kana lavang, kematamuni ku 'emuy'uy i ngaydiran, “taw sinalem na lulang peniya, 'azi pinuwatremel, kadika alamu tremima'a mu!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: dika mi piya meniwan naniyam emaeman, “'alrana mau i inu na puwalrang.” kema i mulri na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: ini na kahuwahuwan mu, kipanadam ku lra kanizu na tematelriw ziya i dare' kana Yécumin zi kalrazaman za akanan, pawnung atalram lra tu ulepan za puwayar meniwan.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: mena'u lra kani i mulri na vavayan tu kinasahasahar na akanan na trungulran, paremamatras ku zi salaw ku semangal.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
